TopicTitle: [Space Science] Plant Growth in Orbit around Kerbin??

Articles.Content:
Greetings,

I was wondering how are you supposed to complete this mission?

I have the Plant Growth module and a Science Lab module. I managed to get to 100,000km orbit.

I started the research but nothing happened after several hours; only generated Eurekas
I had the same problem, any one know how to complete?

I think the plant growth module then has to be returned to Kerbin. Or you can transmit the data. But I'm not sure on that last one.

To be sure, check the thread for the Station Science mod.

I think I had to put a Kerbal in the zoology lab to complete the plant growth experiment.

Edit:

I'll have to check that (might have been another experiment). The station science OP states that only a science lab is needed.

Edited March 29, 2015 by lurkoholic

After you generate 30 Eurekas, you should be able to 'Finalize Results'. After that, you can either transmit the data or return the experiment (the part) to Kerbin. For the contracts, you need to return it. This means that if you attached the part directly to the lab - ie no decouplers or docking ports in between - then you either need to de-orbit your entire station or send another experiment up to complete the contract.

The prcocedure is exactly the same for all experiments, with the only difference being that for others you'll need the other components from the mod (cyclotron, etc)
